{{Infobox video game |title = Shift 2: Unleashed |image = [[File:Shift2-cover.jpg|256px]] |caption = European cover art featuring a [[Nissan GT-R]] and a [[Maserati GranTurismo|Maserati GranTurismo S]]. |developer = [[Slightly Mad Studios]]
[[Straight Right]] (iOS) |publisher = [[Electronic Arts]] |producer = Marcus Nilsson |composer = Heavy Melody Music
[[Ramin Djawadi]]
Troels Folmann
[[Stephen Baysted]]
[[Mick Gordon (composer)|Mick Gordon]]
[[Mike Reagan]] |series = ''[[Need for Speed]]'' |platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]]
[[PlayStation 3]]
[[Xbox 360]]
[[iOS (Apple)|iOS]] |released = '''Microsoft Windows''', '''PlayStation 3''' & '''Xbox 360'''
{{Video game release|NA|March 29, 2011|EU|March 31, 2011|AU|March 31, 2011|UK|April 1, 2011}}'''iOS'''{{vgrelease|WW|August 4, 2011}} |genre = [[Racing game|Racing]] |modes = [[Single-player]], [[Multiplayer video game|multiplayer]] }} '''''Shift 2: Unleashed''''' (also known as '''''Need for Speed: Shift 2 – Unleashed''''') is a [[racing game|racing]] [[video game]], and part of the ''[[Need for Speed]]'' series. It is the seventeenth installment in the long-running ''[[Need for Speed]]'' series. It was developed by [[Slightly Mad Studios]] and published by [[Electronic Arts]]. The game serves as a direct sequel to ''[[Need for Speed: Shift]]'' and expands on many aspects that were introduced in the original.{{cite press release |title=EA's Engine Roar with Shift 2 Unleashed |url=http://www.ea.com/news/ea-engine-roar-with-shift-2-unleashed |publisher=[[Electronic Arts]] |date=2010-11-16 |accessdate=2010-11-16 }}{{cite press release |title=Electronic Arts Reports Q1 FY11 Financial Result |url=http://investor.ea.com/releasedetail.cfm?ReleaseID=496057 |publisher=[[Electronic Arts]] |date=2010-08-03 |accessdate=2010-11-17 }} ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' was released worldwide during March and April 2011,{{cite web|url=http://www.needforspeed.com/post/shift-2-unleashed%E2%84%A2-launch-date-announced |title=SHIFT 2 UNLEASHED Launch Date Announced |date=January 13, 2011 |accessdate= January 14, 2011 |publisher=Needforspeed}}{{cite web|url=http://www.igarchive.com/news/?a=136850&n=Shift+2%3A+Unleashed+release+date+slips+a+week |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111003171434/http://www.igarchive.com/news/?a=136850&n=Shift+2:+Unleashed+release+date+slips+a+week |dead-url=yes |archive-date=October 3, 2011 |title=Shift 2: Unleashed release date slips a week |date=February 18, 2011 |accessdate= March 26, 2011 |publisher=CVG}} although it was not released in Japan. ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' for the [[PlayStation 3]] has been made available as a free download during the month of April 2012 (starting April 3) to [[PlayStation Plus]] subscribers.{{cite web|last=Chen|first=Grace|title=PlayStation Plus April Preview: Free Shank 2 and Shift 2 Unleashed, Ghost Recon Future Soldier Beta|url=http://blog.us.playstation.com/2012/03/26/playstation-plus-april-preview-free-shank-2-and-shift-2-unleashed-ghost-recon-future-soldier-beta/|accessdate=9 April 2012}} ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' features over 145 cars from more than 37 manufacturers and over 36 different tracks, which players can compete in several types of races.{{cite web |url=http://www.needforspeed.com/shift2unleashed/cars |title=Cars |date=2011-01-27|publisher=[[Needforspeed.com]] |accessdate=2011-01-27 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.needforspeed.com/shift2unleashed/tracks |title=Tracks |date=2011-01-27|publisher=[[Needforspeed.com]] |accessdate=2011-01-27 }} Players can also compete online.{{cite web |url=http://www.gamespot.com/ps3/driving/needforspeedshift2/news.html?sid=6284587&mode=previews |title=Shift 2 Unleashed Hands-on |date=2010-11-29 |publisher=[[GameSpot.com]] |accessdate=2010-12-25 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.gametrailers.com/video/ignition-interview-shift-2/707970|title=Shift 2 Unleashed - Ignition Interview|date=2010-11-30 |publisher=[[GameTrailers.com]] |accessdate=2010-12-25 }} The game also features three new main additions: an in-helmet camera, night-time racing and the Autolog feature introduced with ''[[Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit (2010 video game)|Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.needforspeed.com/post/shift-2-unleashed |title=Shift 2 Unleashed |date=2010-11-16 |publisher=[[Needforspeed.com]] |accessdate=2010-12-27 }} ==Gameplay== {{See also|Need for Speed: Shift#Gameplay|l1=Gameplay in Need for Speed: Shift}} ''Shift 2'' claims to redefine the racing simulator genre by delivering authentic and true-to-life dynamic crash physics, intricately detailed real-world cars, drivers and tracks.{{cite web|url=http://news.softpedia.com/news/NFS-Shift-2-Unleashed-Feature-List-and-Career-Trailer-Revealed-181110.shtml |title=NFS: Shift 2 Unleashed Feature List and Career Trailer Revealed |date=January 28, 2011 |accessdate=February 28, 2011 |publisher=Softpedia}} During their careers, virtual racers partake in a variety of motorsports — like drifting, muscle car racing, retro car racing, Endurance races and circuit competition (i.e. FIA GT3 European Championship) — to hone their driving skills in hopes of becoming the FIA GT1 world champion.{{cite web|url=http://wot.motortrend.com/first-play-ea-shows-need-speed-shift-2-unleashed-all-about-36537.html |title=First Play: EA Shows Us What Need For Speed Shift 2 Unleashed is All About |date=March 4, 2011 |accessdate=March 7, 2011 |publisher=MotorTrend}} In the career mode, [[Vaughn Gittin]], a [[Formula D]] Champion guides the player through his career, customizing the car, Autolog, teaching the player how to drift, so the player would head on to the [[FIA GT3]] and the Works series. Then, he begins to move on to the [[FIA GT1 Championship]]. Gittin also explains the Muscle discipline. The career mode also features the Formula D driver [[Darren McNamara]], who explains the Retro discipline, [[Chris Rado]], who explains Time Attack and Drag Racing (DLC) discipline, Eric and Marc Kozeluh, who explains Standing Mile (DLC) discipline, [[Mad Mike Whiddett]], who explains the Works discipline, Executive Vice President of [[Electronic Arts|EA]] Patrick Söderlund, who explains the FIA GT3 discipline, [[Tommy Milner]], who explains the endurance discipline, Matt Powers, who explains the Legends (DLC) discipline, and [[Jamie Campbell-Walter]], who explains the FIA GT1 discipline. As well as an in-car camera view, ''Shift 2'' includes a 'helmet-camera' in which the player's viewpoint is from their driver. The helmet cam moves with the head of the driver, being drawn from side to side as the car takes corners and jerking forward when the player crashes. As the car comes up to higher speeds, the edges of the screen will become blurred to simulate the tunnel-vision effect that drivers suffer when racing.{{cite web|url=http://www.pcgamer.com/2011/01/28/new-need-for-speed-shift-2-details-screens-and-trailer/ |title=New Need for Speed: Shift 2 details, screens and trailer |date=January 28, 2011 |accessdate=February 18, 2011 |publisher=PCGamer}} ''Shift 2'''s night racing also appears to be more advanced, with headlights dimming or turning off completely if damaged, further narrowing the player's view.{{cite web|url=http://www.gamepro.com/article/previews/218546/pax-east-shift-2-unleashed-preview/ |title=PAX East: Shift 2: Unleashed Preview |date=March 17, 2011 |accessdate=March 22, 2011 |publisher=GamePro|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http://www.gamepro.com/article/previews/218546/pax-east-shift-2-unleashed-preview/&date=2011-11-30+22:18:52|archivedate=2011-12-01}} The Autolog system is now 'Need for Speed DNA'. The system appears in ''Shift 2'' in a more-or-less identical design to the original, but includes extra features that they not only provide track times for unique events, but also segregate data based on quick race tracks, race types and automotive disciplines. This essentially means that Autolog is more than just a system that simply displays player friend’s times regardless of how, or when, they set them during their career. ''Shift 2'' features more than 140 licensed vehicles available for racing and tuning, a smaller number compared with racing sims such as ''[[Forza Motorsport 4]]'', and the 1200 cars found in ''[[Gran Turismo 6]]''. However, executive producer Marcus Nilsson said the studio wanted to concentrate on having only the must-have speedsters.{{cite web|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/gamehunters/post/2011/02/behind-the-wheel-of-shift-2-unleashed/1 |title=Behind the wheel of 'Shift 2 Unleashed' |date=February 28, 2011 |accessdate=March 1, 2011 |publisher=USA Today}}{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/289755/news/shift-2-unleashed-gets-exclusive-next-gen-supercar-trailer/ |title=Shift 2: Unleashed gets exclusive 'next gen supercar' - trailer |date=2011-02-18 |accessdate=2011-02-19 |publisher=CVG}} There are also 40 real-world locations including [[Mount Panorama Circuit|Bathurst]], [[Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps|Spa-Francorchamps]] and [[Suzuka Circuit|Suzuka]] as well as fictional circuits like downtown [[London]] and [[Shanghai]]. Lead designer Andy Tutor confirmed that ''Shift 2'' doesn't feature split-screen, saying, "There’s so much going on in the game, for example we’ve added if you’re drafting a guy now you’ll get all the little bits of crap from his car, all the gravel and rubber hit the car and they can hit your windscreen and things like that. It takes a lot of development time but it’s very authentic and that’s the experience we want. Unfortunately that means things like split-screen aren’t possible."{{cite web|url=http://www.thatvideogameblog.com/2010/11/30/interview-shift-2-unleashed-lead-designer-andy-tutor/ |title=Interview / Shift 2 Unleashed lead designer Andy Tutor |date=2010-11-30 |accessdate=2011-03-09 |publisher=That Videogame Blog}} ==Development== In early July 2010 it was rumored that a sequel for ''Shift'' was in development, called "''Need for Speed: Shift 2''" and to be developed by [[Slightly Mad Studios]].{{cite web|url=http://news.bigdownload.com/2010/07/01/rumor-more-need-for-speed-shift-coming/ |title=Rumor: Need For Speed Shift 2 coming? |publisher=News.bigdownload.com |date=2010-07-01 |accessdate=2010-11-17}} In February 2010, [[EA]] said another ''[[Need for Speed]]'' game will be released at some point during its fourth quarter (1 January through 31 March 2011).{{cite web|author=Wesley Yin-Poole |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/nfs-shift-2-in-the-works |title=Need for Speed: SHIFT 2 in the works? |publisher=Eurogamer.net |date=2010-07-01 |accessdate=2010-11-17}} The rumors started when Chris McClure, who left Slightly Mad Studios for CCP, updated his profile on professional networking site Linkedin to include the work he had been doing prior to his departure. His CV read: "Mostly worked on new [[Need for Speed: World|open world technology]] but also worked on Need For Speed Shift 2."{{cite web |last=Aiton |first=Ewan |url=http://play.tm/news/30884/cv-outs-need-for-speed-shift-2/ |title=CV outs Need for Speed Shift 2 |publisher=Play.tm |date=2010-07-01 |accessdate=2010-11-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101127202858/http://play.tm/news/30884/cv-outs-need-for-speed-shift-2/ |archivedate=2010-11-27 |df= }}{{cite web |url=http://www.totalvideogames.com/Need-for-Speed-Shift-2-Unannounced/news/Need-For-Speed-Shift-2-Mooted-15428.html |title=Need For Speed Shift 2 Mooted News |publisher=Totalvideogames.com |date= |accessdate=2010-11-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308095009/http://www.totalvideogames.com/Need-for-Speed-Shift-2-Unannounced/news/Need-For-Speed-Shift-2-Mooted-15428.html |archivedate=2012-03-08 |df= }} ''Shift 2'' was confirmed when EA listed the game in their first quarter financial report as a Q4 2011 title (i.e. Q1 2011 in calendar year) for consoles and PC.{{cite web |url=http://www.gamespot.com/pc/action/deadspace2/news.html?sid=6272151 |title=Crysis 2 delayed, Need for Speed Shift 2 announced |author=Brendan Sinclair |date=2010-08-03 |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |accessdate=2010-08-05 }} The game was officially announced as ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' on 16 November 2010 with a teaser trailer, the same day as ''[[Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit (2010 video game)|Hot Pursuit]]'' was released in the US . ''Shift 2'' brings an "all-new" rendering engine and a "massive" graphics overhaul. "With an innovative helmet camera view simulating the physical experience of driving at 200mph, the thrilling experience of night racing and authentic degradation of tracks and cars, this is tomorrow's sim for today's adrenaline fuelled racer." said EA at the press time. ''Shift 2'' is redefining immersive racing by blending the rush of tearing up the track at unbelievable speeds with the emotional experience of competitive battle", said executive producer Marcus Nilsson. "We are also working closely with real-world performance drivers to ensure that ''Shift 2 Unleashed'' captures their experience and becomes the benchmark in authentic racing action." Two weeks before ''Shift 2'' was announced did EA executive Patrick Soderlund said, "We think we can compete and ultimately become market leading in the simulation authentic motorsport segment. One of the strongest points we have is, apart from the fact we have a very talented developer working with us and we now have an established brand underneath the ''NFS'' umbrella in that segment, we also have the advantage of being a multi-platform offering. [[Forza Motorsport 3|Forza]] can only be bought on Xbox and ''[[Gran Turismo (series)|Gran Turismo]]'' is only available on PlayStation. We're the only one right now that is of a significant weight that can offer something up on all those platforms."{{cite web|author=Wesley Yin-Poole |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2010-11-16-need-for-speed-shift-2-announced |title=Shift 2 Unleashed announced |publisher=Eurogamer.net |date=2010-11-02 |accessdate=2010-11-17}}{{cite web |url= http://www.needforspeed.com/post/shift-2-unleashed |title=Shift 2 Unleashed |date=2010-11-16 |publisher=[[Needforspeed.com]] |accessdate=2010-12-27 }} Marcus Nilsson, producer of the game, said that ''Shift 2'' won't match [[Forza Motorsport 3|Forza]]'s 60 frames per second performance, but indicated it will be a far more vibrant game as a result. "You have to make a choice with today's tech. Either you go for - and this is harsh but it's what I think - the bland graphics of [[Gran Turismo 5|GT]] and [[Forza Motorsport 3|Forza]], or you try to push the bar for what consoles can do." said Nilsson.{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/article.php?id=276019 |title=News: 'Bland' Gran Turismo, Forza graphics avoided by NFS: Shift 2 - dev |publisher=ComputerAndVideoGames.com |date= |accessdate=2010-11-17}} EA's Patrick Soderlund revealed that he believes ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' can outdo ''[[Gran Turismo 5]] '' when it comes to providing an "authentic driving experience".{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerzines.com/ps3/news/shift-2-to-beat-gt5.html |title=EA: SHIFT 2 Unleashed will beat Gran Turismo 5 |author=Andy Griffiths |date=2010-11-23 |publisher=[[GamerZines]] |accessdate=2010-12-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110506013412/http://www.gamerzines.com/ps3/news/shift-2-to-beat-gt5.html |archivedate=2011-05-06 |df= }} Both the lead designer and executive producer of ''Shift 2'' spoke out against ''GT5'', implying that it has way too many cars.{{cite web|url=http://www.thekoalition.com/need-for-speed-shift-2-team-takes-shots-at-gt5 |title=Need For Speed Shift 2 Team Takes Shots At GT5 |date= |publisher=[[The Koalition]] |accessdate=2010-12-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101231082558/http://www.thekoalition.com/need-for-speed-shift-2-team-takes-shots-at-gt5 |archivedate=December 31, 2010 }} Andy Tudor, lead designer of the game, said that games like ''[[Gran Turismo 5]]'' and ''[[Forza Motorsport 3]]'', were more like encyclopedias than games, and featured hundreds of "irrelevant cars". Tudor said "You can add hundreds of cars to your game, but people will ignore most of them."{{cite web |url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/news/view/105793-Shift-2-Unleashed-Dev-Attacks-Rivals-Over-Irrelevant-Cars |title=Shift 2: Unleashed Dev Attacks Rivals Over "Irrelevant" Cars |date=2010-12-02 |publisher=[[The Escapist (magazine)|The Escapist]] |accessdate=2010-12-23 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.lazygamer.net/nfs-shift-2-dev-rips-gt5-and-forza-a-new-one/ |archive-url=https://archive.is/20110817022528/http://www.lazygamer.net/nfs-shift-2-dev-rips-gt5-and-forza-a-new-one/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2011-08-17 |title=NFS: Shift 2 dev rips GT5 and Forza a new one |date=2010-12-01 |publisher=[[Lazygamer]] |accessdate=2010-12-23 }} ''Need for Speed'' producer Jesse Abney thought that ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' will cross the racing divide to entice arcade fans as well as sim fans. Regarding the first ''Shift'', "‘accessible’ was used a lot, to the chagrin of simulation fans," the producer told NowGamer. "But you want those incremental steps to be a bit of a handholding exercise – ''Shift'' was developed as an acknowledgement that our fan base has grown up with us over 17 years. Their interests have changed. Some of them have grown up to become the race drivers we talk to today. They want that type of game. So we knew to acknowledge them and their interests, we really had to build an authentic racing game. And that’s what ''Shift'' was."{{cite web|last=Hopkins |first=Tom |url=http://www.nowgamer.com/news/5149/shift-2-for-arcade-and-sim-fans/ |title=Shift 2: 'For Arcade And Sim Fans' |publisher=Now Gamer |date=2011-02-08 |accessdate=2011-02-09 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Lead designer, Andy Tudor said ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' is injecting "emotional and social aspects" into the sequel, which take it beyond "being a numbers game". "The simulation genre, really, is just a numbers game at the moment; it’s all about, ‘We’ve got the greatest physics engine, and we’re going to add 1,000 cars, tracks etcetera.’ It’s quite a dry experience. We want to turn that on its head, by adding in social features, such as Autolog. I’ve gone on record before saying ''GT5'' and ''Forza'' are on pedestals at the moment: everyone believes they are the games to beat. They have great products, but they stop at being a numbers game, a mathematical simulation of great physics, whereas we go beyond that with the emotional and social aspects."{{cite web |url=http://www.strategyinformer.com/news/11209/slighty-mad-racing-sim-quite-dry-shift-2-turns-that-on-its-head |title=Slighty Mad: Racing sim 'quite dry', Shift 2 turns that "on its head" |date=2011-02-28 |accessdate=2011-03-01 |publisher=StrategyInformer |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318022530/http://www.strategyinformer.com/news/11209/slighty-mad-racing-sim-quite-dry-shift-2-turns-that-on-its-head |archivedate=2012-03-18 |df= }}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/gamesblog/2011/feb/28/gamesblog-live-andy-tudor |title=Gamesblog Live: Need for Speed Shift 2's Andy Tudor on simulation versus emotion |date=2011-02-28 |accessdate=2011-03-01 |publisher=Guardian UK}} Marcus Nilson said that Autolog has changes since ''Hot Pursuit'', "Yeah. You racing in the game becomes the fuel for other people to race, it's brilliant. Slightly Mad Studios has been working with [[Criterion Games|Criterion]] from really early on exchanging ideas and executing on the core tenants that Criterion came up with. We're implementing it slightly differently but integrating more into the core experience of what the game is. I don't want the game to feel like I have a career and then I can go online to compete with my friends, I want it to feel like one whole. Autolog really weaves everything together into one compelling package. If you race this game and you beat people on your friends list, that's going to give you more XP to propel you in your career." ===Spin-off=== Marcus Nilsson, the executive producer of ''Shift 2: Unleashed'', said this about why they decide to drop the ''Need for Speed'' name for ''Shift 2'', "If you think about the ''Need for Speed'' games you've played; ''[[Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit (2010 video game)|Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit]]'', ''[[Need for Speed: Most Wanted (2005 video game)|Most Wanted]]'', ''[[Need for Speed: Underground|Underground]]'', they're very arcadey and action-oriented. ''Shift'' is going after a different audience, a sim audience, and it's about driving cars the way they feel in real life. So to not confuse the consumer - don't take me wrong, ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' is still a ''Need for Speed'' game inside the ''Need for Speed'' family, but that family has different legs. ''Hot Pursuit'' fits the action games; ''Shift 2'' is sim-like."{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerzines.com/ps3/previews/shift-2-unleashed-interview.html |title=INTERVIEW: Shift 2: Unleashed |author=David Scammell |date=2010-12-02 |publisher=[[GamerZines]] |accessdate=2010-12-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101226090859/http://www.gamerzines.com/ps3/previews/shift-2-unleashed-interview.html |archivedate=2010-12-26 |df= }} [[EA]] wanted to establish ''Shift'' as a new franchise when ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' was released in March. The [[Need for Speed: Shift|original]] was part of the ''Need for Speed'' family, but the sequel branches out in order to win over simulation racer fans and compete with genre rival ''[[Gran Turismo (series)|Gran Turismo]]''. {{cquote|“''Shift'' is still part of the ''Need for Speed'' family, but it offers a very different experience from our traditional ''Need for Speed'' action racers. With ''Shift 2: Unleashed'', we aim to redefine sim racing so that fans get as close to the feeling of real racing as possible. Sim racers are proving very popular with consumers – ''[[F1 2010 (video game)|F1 2010]]'' and ''[[Gran Turismo 5|GT5]]'' have done great numbers. The game will still embody the core values of ''Need for Speed'', but we want to establish ''Shift'' as our clearly defined simulation racer. Our ''Need for Speed'' strategy is to create the best racing and driving experiences for all racing fans. The use of ''Shift'' as a franchise name is reflective of our desire to establish it as the best simulation racer in the market with its own unique, distinct positioning.” EA’s racing and action business lead Colin Blackwood told MCV.{{cite web |last=Batchelor |first=James |url=http://www.mcvuk.com/news/42815/EAs-Shift-set-for-NFS-IP-spin-off |title=EA's Shift set for NFS IP spin-off |publisher=MCV |date=2011-02-01 |accessdate=2011-02-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110206145614/http://www.mcvuk.com/news/42815/EAs-Shift-set-for-NFS-IP-spin-off |archivedate=2011-02-06 |df= }}}} ==Soundtrack== As with the previous ''Need for Speed'' games, ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' soundtrack contains a variety of licensed music. ''Shift 2 Unleashed'' also contains original soundtracks played during main menu, loading screen, and replay, composed by [[Ramin Djawadi]], [[Stephen Baysted]], Troels Folmann, [[Mick Gordon (composer)|Mick Gordon,]] and [[Mike Reagan]]. ==Marketing and release== The game was set for a release in North America on 8 March 2011 and in Europe on 10 March, according to many websites, include [[GameStop]] and [[GameSpot]].{{cite web |url=http://www.gamestop.com/Catalog/ProductDetails.aspx?product_id=88440|title=Shift 2 Unleashed Limited Edition - NA GameStop |date=|publisher=[[GameStop.com]] |accessdate=2010-01-05 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/pc/driving/needforspeedshift2/index.html?tag=result%3Btitle%3B0 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130123234634/http://www.gamespot.com/pc/driving/needforspeedshift2/index.html?tag=result;title;0 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-01-23 |title=Shift 2 Unleashed - GameSpot |date= |publisher=[[GameSpot.com]] |accessdate=2010-01-05 }}{{cite web |url=http://gamestop.no/HSALE2010/index.html|title=Shift 2: Unleashed Limited Edition – Norwegian GameStop|date=|publisher=[[GameStop.com]] |accessdate=2010-01-05 }}{{cite web |title='Need for Speed: Shift 2 Unleased' (ALL) Gets Euro Date |url=http://worthplaying.com/article/2011/1/4/news/79122/ |date=2011-01-04 |author=Rainier |publisher=[[WorthPlaying]] |accessdate=2011-01-11 }} On 13 January, EA announced that the game will be released on 24 March 2011 in Europe, on 25 March in UK and on 29 March in US. In a press release issued on 18 February 2011, EA mentioned ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' has slipped a week in the Europe to 31 March and in the UK to 1 April. In addition to the Standard edition, a ''Limited Edition'' of the game has been announced, which is available only through pre-order. The ''Limited Edition'' features numerous bonuses over the Standard edition, including exclusive packaging, instant access to three exclusive cars plus an additional 40 career race events.{{cite web |url=http://www.needforspeed.com/post/pre-order-shift-2-unleashed%E2%84%A2-today-secure-your-limited-edition-copy |title=Pre-order SHIFT 2 UNLEASHED today to secure your Limited Edition Copy |date=2010-12-16 |publisher=[[Needforspeed.com]] |accessdate=2010-12-23 }} [[Alpinestars]] and ''[[Need for Speed]]'' introduced the ''Play a Pro Sweepstakes'', a contest that gives the winner chance to win a trip to attend the [[Formula Drift]] in [[Grand Prix of Long Beach|Long Beach]], California on 8 and 9 April 2011, available to residents of the United States only. The winner will receive a trip to Long Beach, California and pit passes to the Formula Drift in Long Beach and an opportunity to play against an Alpinestars drift driver in ''Shift 2: Unleashed''.{{cite web|url=http://www.needforspeed.com/post/alpinestars-need-speed-presents-play-pro-sweepstakes?source=shift2 |title=Alpinestars & Need for Speed Presents the PLAY A PRO SWEEPSTAKES |publisher=Needforspeed.com |date=2011-02-07 |accessdate=2010-02-08}} EA had an exposition for ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' at [[Penny Arcade Expo#PAX East 2011|PAX East 2011]], where ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' had two [[D-Box]] racing seats set up each with its own 103" plasma TV, and several other stations. Pre-ordering ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' at PAX EAST, includes ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' branded ear bud head phones and a T-shirt as pre-order bonus.{{cite web|url=http://www.needforspeed.com/post/shift-2-unleashed-going-pax-east?source=shift2 |title=SHIFT 2 UNLEASHED IS GOING TO PAX EAST! |date=2010-03-08 |accessdate=2011-03-12 |publisher=Needforspeed.com}} ===Trailers=== In addition to the trailer shown at the official reveal, four other game trailers have been released so far, each revealing new aspects of the game. One trailer promoted the launch date, which also shows the actual gameplay for the first time to public, an in-car racing sequence between McPhillamy Park to Forrest's Elbow at the Mt Panorama circuit, Bathurst. One trailer promoted the ''Limited Edition'' of the game.{{cite web |url=http://www.needforspeed.com/post/shift-2-unleashed%E2%84%A2-limited-edition-trailer |title=SHIFT 2 Unleashed Limited Edition Trailer |date=2011-01-21 |publisher=Needforspeed.com |accessdate=2011-02-08 }} A Career trailer was released in the end of January 2011, which was the same day as the official website for ''Shift 2'' launched.{{cite web |url=http://www.needforspeed.com/post/shift-2-unleashed%E2%84%A2-career-trailer?source=shift2 |title=SHIFT 2 Unleashed Career Trailer |date=2011-01-26 |publisher=needforspeed.com |accessdate=2011-02-08 }} A video clip of ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' surfaced showing off a Team BMW race around a circuit in sunny Miami, the footage is from a GTTV show in which brand new gameplay was shown.{{cite web |url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/287384/news/need-for-speed-shift-2-gameplay-video-shows-miami/ |title=Need for Speed Shift 2 gameplay video shows Miami |date=2011-02-06 |publisher=CVG |accessdate=2011-02-08 }} The first developer diary was released on 23 February 2011, which showcased a combination of some real-life racing and gameplay. It also explains how hard Slightly Mad Studios worked to rope in real life racer in order to flesh out the real life racing experience for the game. The video also shows off night-time racing, drifting, all new helmet camera, plus real-time telemetry, what the developer calls the "most realistic" physics engine ever used in a commercial racing video game.{{cite web|url=http://www.gamepur.com/news/2859-shift-2-unleashed-first-developer-diary-out-now.html |title=Shift 2 Unleashed first developer diary out now, shows actual game footage |date=2011-02-24 |accessdate=2011-02-24 |publisher=Gamepur}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2011/02/24/first-shift-2-dev-diary-details-real-racing/ |title=First Shift 2 dev diary details "real racing" |date=2011-02-24 |accessdate=2011-02-24 |publisher=VG247}} The second developer diary was released on 7 March 2011, which showcased the game's Autolog customization feature.{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/292315/news/shift-2-unleashed-autolog-customisation-trailer/ |title=Shift 2 Unleashed Autolog customisation trailer |date=2011-03-07 |accessdate=2011-03-07 |publisher=CVG}} The third developer diary was released 10 March 2011, which showcased some of the real world's most dangerous corners in racing.{{cite web|url=http://www.gametrailers.com/video/dangerous-corners-shift-2/711555 |title=Dangerous Corners Part I |date=2011-03-10 |accessdate=2011-03-12 |publisher=GameTrailers}} Another trailer released was about the Pagani Huayra, which it is shown at high speeds in various circuits. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | MC = (PC) 84/100{{cite web |url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/shift-2-unleashed |title=Shift 2: Unleashed for PC Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=2012-03-13}}
(PS3) 81/100{{cite web |url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-3/shift-2-unleashed |title=Shift 2: Unleashed for PlayStation 3 Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=2012-03-13}}
(X360) 82/100{{cite web |url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/shift-2-unleashed |title=Shift 2: Unleashed for Xbox 360 Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=2012-03-13}}
(iOS) 72/100{{cite web |url=https://www.metacritic.com/game/ios/shift-2-unleashed |title=Shift 2 Unleashed for iPhone/iPad Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=2018-11-13}} | 1UP = B+{{cite web|url=http://www.1up.com/reviews/shift-2-unleashed-review|title=Shift 2: Unleashed Review for PC, PS3, 360 from 1UP.com|work=1Up.com|accessdate=30 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/67VF1f97T?url=http://www.1up.com/reviews/shift-2-unleashed-review|archivedate=8 May 2012|df=}} | EuroG = 8/10{{cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-03-29-shift-2-unleashed-review?page=2|title=SHIFT 2: Unleashed Review • Page 2 • Eurogamer.net|date=29 March 2011|work=Eurogamer.net|accessdate=30 June 2015}} | GSpot = 7.5/10{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/reviews/shift-2-unleashed-review/1900-6306558/|title=Shift 2: Unleashed Review|author=Joseph Barron|work=GameSpot|accessdate=30 June 2015}} | GRadar = 4.5/5{{cite web|url=http://www.gamesradar.com/ps3/shift-2-unleashed/review/shift-2-unleashed-review/a-20110329124932242080/g-2010111610534993000/p-2|title=Shift 2 Unleashed review|author=GamesRadarMichaelGrimm|date=29 March 2011|work=GamesRadar+|accessdate=30 June 2015}} | GTM = 60%http://www.gamestm.co.uk/reviews/shift-2-unleashed-review/ | GT = 8.9/10{{cite web|url=http://www.gametrailers.com/game/shift-2-unleashed/13656|title=Need for Speed SHIFT 2 Unleashed|date=28 March 2011|work=GameTrailers|accessdate=30 June 2015}} | IGN = 8.5/10{{cite web|url=http://uk.xbox360.ign.com/articles/115/1157453p1.html|title=Shift 2 Unleashed Review|work=IGN|accessdate=30 June 2015}} | Play = 66% | PSM3 = 66% | rev1 = ''[[TouchArcade]]'' | rev1Score = (iOS) {{rating|2.5|5}}{{cite web |url=https://toucharcade.com/2011/08/09/shift-2-unleashed-review-asleep-at-the-wheel/ |title='Shift 2 Unleashed' Review – Asleep at the Wheel |last=Dyer |first=Mitch |date=2011-08-09 |website=[[TouchArcade]] |accessdate=2018-11-13}} }} ''Shift 2: Unleashed'' was met with generally positive reviews. Aggregating review website [[Metacritic]] gave the PC version 84/100, the Xbox 360 version 82/100, the PlayStation 3 version 81/100. [[GameTrailers]] rated the game an 8.9/10, saying how it "Refines the strengths of the first game and extends their value indefinitely through the competitive environment of autolog. There aren't any breakthrough new features here, but this is a racer that will constantly push you to improve and make you sweat under the pressure." It gained an 8/10 rating from [[Eurogamer]], stating: "As an update to the previous SHIFT title, Unleashed is a significant draft forward. While the driving itself retains the boisterous character of its predecessor, there's been a considerable tightening of focus in the experience system, which makes every race feel meaningful whether you win or lose." It gained a 7.5/10 rating from [[GameSpot]], stating how "Shift 2 may not offer full-on simulation features, but it boasts roller-coaster thrills and a deep sense of immersion in the hectic world of racing." {{clear}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{Need for Speed series}} {{Slightly Mad Studios}} [[Category:2011 video games]] [[Category:Electronic Arts games]] [[Category:IOS games]] [[Category:Need for Speed games|* 17]] [[Category:PlayStation 3 games]] [[Category:Racing simulators]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Video games set in Australia]] [[Category:Video games set in Belgium]] [[Category:Video games set in California]] [[Category:Video games set in England]] [[Category:Video games set in Germany]] [[Category:Video games set in Italy]] [[Category:Video games set in Japan]] [[Category:Video games set in London]] [[Category:Video games set in Miami]] [[Category:Video games set in Shanghai]] [[Category:Video games set in Tokyo]] [[Category:Video games set in Spain]] [[Category:Video games set in the Czech Republic]] [[Category:Video games set in the United States]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox 360 games]] [[Category:Video games set in Dubai]] [[Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Australia]]

Ultimate Team Challenge | image = spartan-race.jpg | image_size = 260px | image_alt = | caption = | show_name_2 = | genre = | creator = | based_on = | developer = | writer = | screenplay = | story = | director = Kent Weed | creative_director = | presenter = {{Plain list | '''Season 1''' * [[Dhani Jones]] * [[Kyle Martino]] * MJ Acosta * [[Evan Dollard]]{{cite web|url=http://www.nbc.com/spartan-ultimate-team-challenge?nbc=1|title=About the Show|work=NBCUniversal|accessdate=April 4, 2016}} '''Season 2''' * [[Apolo Ohno]] * Kelvin Washington * MJ Acosta * [[Nick Swisher]] }} | starring = | judges = | voices = | narrated = | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = United States | language = English | num_seasons = 2 | num_episodes = 14 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = [[Arthur Smith (producer)|Arthur Smith]]
Kent Weed
Anthony Storm
Joe DeSena
Jeffrey Connor
Kenneth C. Koleyni | producer = | editor = | location = | cinematography = | camera = [[Multiple-camera setup|Multiple-camera]] | runtime = | company = A. Smith & Company | distributor = | budget = | channel = [[NBC]] | picture_format = [[1080i]] ([[High-definition television|HDTV]]) | audio_format = | first_run = | released = | first_aired = {{Start date|2016|6|13}} | last_aired = {{Start date|2017|7|23}} | preceded_by = | followed_by = | related = | website = http://www.nbc.com/spartan-ultimate-team-challenge?nbc=1 | website_title = | production_website = http://www.spartancasting.com/ | production_website_title = Spartan Casting }} '''''Spartan: Ultimate Team Challenge''''' is an American [[sports entertainment]] competition series based on the [[obstacle racing|obstacle race]] [[Spartan race|of a similar name]]. Greenlighted to order on August 26, 2015, the series premiered on June 13, 2016 on [[NBC]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2016/04/01/the-night-shift-and-spartan-ultimate-team-challenge-set-june-debuts-140110/20160401nbc02/|title='The Night Shift' and 'Spartan: Ultimate Team Challenge' Set June Debuts|work=The Futon Critic|accessdate=April 1, 2016}} On March 17, 2017, NBC renewed the series for a second season which premiered on June 12, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/03/nbc-summer-schedule-americas-got-talent-marlon-carmichael-show-world-of-dance-1202045777/|title=NBC Sets Summer Premieres: ‘Marlon,’ ‘Midnight, Texas,’ ‘Carmichael Show,’ Reality & More|last=Pedersen|first=Erik|work=Deadline Hollywood|date=March 17, 2017|accessdate=March 17, 2017}} The second season concluded with "Strike a Pose" winning the grand prize of $250,000{{Cite web|url=https://www.wnypapers.com/news/article/current/2017/07/24/129221/spartan-ultimate-team-challenge-crowns-a-winner|title='Spartan: Ultimate Team Challenge' crowns a winner|last=PSG|first=360|website=www.wnypapers.com|access-date=2018-08-08}}. == Premise == The series will bring people together in teams of five – two men, two women, and an "elite Spartan athlete" who will be picked by the show and serve as team captain. The elite athlete will either be from the Spartan Pro Team or from a different field of expertise. == Production == {{update|section|date=May 2017}} The deadline for applications for season one was September 27, 2015.{{cite web|title=Dates and Locations for Regional Rounds and Finals|url=http://www.spartancasting.com/|website=Spartan Casting|publisher=NBC|accessdate=November 3, 2015}} Competitors will have to face their physical and mental limits while racing through a one-mile obstacle course over fire, water, and mud for the opportunity to win $250,000.{{cite news|last1=Davis|first1=Matt|title=Spartan Race Launching "Short Course" TV Show|url=http://obstacleracingmedia.com/ocr-news/spartan-race-launching-short-course-tv-show/|accessdate=October 24, 2015|work=Obstacle Racing Media|date=August 26, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Casting Begins for New NBC Competition Series "Spartan Race"|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2015/08/26/casting-begins-for-new-nbc-competition-series-spartan-race-135110/20150826nbc02/|accessdate=October 24, 2015|work=The Futon Critic|publisher=Futon Media|date=August 26, 2015}} A total of fourteen episodes have been ordered by NBC. == Spartan Obstacles == Iconic Spartan Obstacles include: '''The Tire Swing:''' Teams must swing across a pool of water on a giant tire propelling and catching their teammates. '''The Barrel Roll:''' The Spartans must spin a large steel barrel together over a distance before locking it into place. '''The Slip Wall:''' A large slippery wall on a steep angle that teams must create a human ladder to climb. '''The Dunk Wall:''' An elevated pool that features various walls that Spartans must either swim under or climb over. '''The Zip Log:''' A zip obstacle that all team members must jump and hold and ride until they reach the end of the track. '''The Timber Drop:''' A large beam must be lifted and flung on a truss platform. Once in place the team must climb the beam together. '''The Human Ladder:''' Teams must climb a spinning ladder strung above a pool. The team members must climb over each other to reach the top without falling in the water. '''Totem Climb:''' The Spartan team must climb a rope suspended above a pool, they may only move onto the next obstacles once all of the team have climbed onto the rope. '''Table Tilt:''' A large rectangular structure on a spinning pivot suspended above a pool. Teams must use their collective balance to one by one climb over the table to the other side of the pool. '''Car Crank:''' Spartan teams must spin and crank that elevates a car into the air.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/meet-latina-sportscaster-mj-acosta-nbc-s-spartan-ultimate-team-n775451|title=Meet Latina sportscaster MJ Acosta, of NBC's 'Spartan: Ultimate Team Challenge'|work=NBC News|access-date=2018-02-06|language=en-US}} == Ratings == === Season 1 === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; width: 74%" |- ! revision.text:
'''Stephen Baker''' (April 17, 1921, [[Vienna, Austria]]-September 13, 2004, [[Manhattan, New York City]]) was a [[Ethology|animal behaviorist]], advertising executive, author and humorist of Austrian origin
Born Steven Bacher in Vienna, Baker, both artist and writer, created the "Let your fingers do the walking" ad campaign for the [[AT&T]] [[Yellow Pages]] as art director for the [[advertising agency]] [[Cunningham & Walsh]].
Baker wrote 22 books on various topics, from "The Systematic Approach to Advertising Creativity" and "Advertising Layout and Art Direction," to "How to Look like Somebody in Business without Being Anybody," "How to Get a Job without Asking for It" and "I Hate Meetings."
"How to Live with a Neurotic Dog", published in 1960, sold more than 200,000 copies.
Other works include "How to Live with a Neurotic Cat" and "How to Play Golf in the Low 120's".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2004/09/24/obituaries/stephen-baker-ad-executive-dies-at-83.html|title=Stephen Baker, Ad Executive, Dies at 83|first=Jennifer|last=Bayot|date=24 September 2004|publisher=|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Baker, Stephen}} [[Category:1921 births]] [[Category:2004 deaths]] [[Category:Ethologists]] [[Category:Austrian writers]] [[Category:Humorists]]

revision.text:
'''Tax Freedom Day''' is the first day of the year in which a [[nation]] as a whole has theoretically earned enough income to pay its taxes. Every dollar that is officially considered income by the government is counted, and every payment to the government that is officially considered a tax is counted. Taxes at all levels of government – local, state and federal – are included. ==Purpose== According to Neil Veldhuis, Director of Fiscal Studies, Fraser Institute, the purpose of Tax Freedom Day is to provide citizens of tax-paying countries with a metric with which to estimate their "total tax bill". The premise is that by comparing the benefits received by citizens to the amount they pay in taxes, the value of paying taxes can be assessed. == History and methodology == The concept of Tax Freedom Day was developed in 1948 by Florida businessman Dallas Hostetler, who trademarked the phrase "Tax Freedom Day" and calculated it each year for the next two decades.[[Madsen Pirie]], ''Think Tank: A Story of the Adam Smith Institute'', [[Biteback Publishing]], 2012, p. 168 In 1971, Hostetler retired and transferred the trademark to the [[Tax Foundation]].[http://tess2.uspto.gov/bin/gate.exe?f=searchss&state=4004:unant9.1.1 U.S. Patent and Trademark Office, "Tax Freedom Day"] The Tax Foundation has calculated Tax Freedom Day for the United States ever since, using it as a tool for illustrating the proportion of national income diverted to fund the annual cost of [[government]] programs. In 1990, the Tax Foundation began calculating the specific Tax Freedom Day for each individual state. Tax Freedom Day only examines taxation, and does not account for debt and inflation as means for funding government. # [[Government debt|Debt]] comes with a guarantee of future repayment. Governments run at a deficit by promising creditors to service and repay debts by taxing future labor or generating revenue through other means such as sale or exploitation of state owned assets. # [[Inflation]] or currency debasement increases the supply of currency. This new currency could be used to pay for government, but the increased supply results in a decrease in value of each unit of currency. As the value of currency decreases, commodity prices increase as a result. [[Leap year]]s have one day more, 29 February. This creates some bias in Tax Freedom Day charts. However, this bias is equal to roughly 1/366, which is about 0.27%. ==United States== {{See also|Taxation in the United States}} In the [[United States]], it is annually calculated by the [[Tax Foundation]], a [[Washington, D.C.]]-based tax research organization. In the U.S., Tax Freedom Day for 2015 is April 24, for a total average effective tax rate of 31 percent of the nation's income. The latest that Tax Freedom Day has occurred was May 1 in 2000. In 1900, Tax Freedom Day arrived January 22, for an effective average total tax rate of 5.9 percent of the nation's income. According to the Tax Foundation, the most important factor driving changes in Tax Freedom Day from year to year is growth in incomes, as the progressive structure of the U.S. federal tax system causes taxes as a percentage of income to rise along with inflation. Tax Freedom Day varies among the 50 U.S. states, as incomes and state and local taxes differ from state to state. In 2015, [[Louisiana]] had the lowest total tax burden, earning enough to pay all their tax obligations by April 2. [[Connecticut]] had the heaviest tax burden – Tax Freedom Day there arrived May 13. According to the Tax Foundation, the following is a list of Tax Freedom Days in the U.S. since 1900:[http://www.taxfoundation.org/taxdata/show/386.html The Tax Foundation – Tax Freedom Day and Tax Burden, 1900–2010] {| class="wikitable" ! Year !! TFD !! Percentage tax burden |- | 1900|| January 22 ||5.9% |- | 1910|| January 19 ||5.0% |- | 1920|| February 13 ||12.0% |- | 1930|| February 12 ||11.7% |- | 1940|| March 7 ||17.9% |- | 1950|| March 31 ||24.6% |- | 1960|| April 11 ||27.7% |- | 1970|| April 19 ||29.6% |- | 1980|| April 21 ||30.4% |- | 1990|| April 21 ||30.4% |- | 2000|| May 1 ||33.0% |- | 2001|| April 27 ||31.8% |- | 2002|| April 17 ||29.2% |- | 2003|| April 14 ||28.4% |- | 2004|| April 15 ||28.5% |- | 2005|| April 21 ||30.2% |- | 2006|| April 26 ||31.2% |- | 2007|| April 24 ||31.1% |- | 2008|| April 16 ||29.0% |- | 2009|| April 8 ||26.6% |- | 2010|| April 9 ||26.9% |- | 2011|| April 12 ||27.7% |- | 2012|| April 13 ||29.2% |- | 2013|| April 18 ||29.4%http://taxfoundation.org/article/tax-freedom-day-2013-april-18-five-days-later-last-year |- | 2014|| April 21 ||30.2%http://taxfoundation.org/article/tax-freedom-day-2014-april-21-three-days-later-last-year |- | 2015|| April 24 || 31%{{cite web|url=http://taxfoundation.org/article/tax-freedom-day-2015-april-24th|title=Tax Freedom Day® 2015 is April 24th|first=Kyle|last=Pomerleau|publisher=Tax Foundation|date=2015-03-30|accessdate=2015-04-14}} |} ==Around the world== Many other organizations in countries throughout the world now produce their own "Tax Freedom Day" analysis. According to the Tax Foundation, Tax Freedom Day reports are currently being published in eight countries. Due to the different ways that nations collect and categorize public finance data, however, Tax Freedom Days are not comparable from one country to another. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ '''Tax Freedom Days for countries by date''' ! Country !! Day of year !! % burden !! class="unsortable" |Date of year !! [http://en.svetilnik-slovenija.org/publications/2015/tax-freedom-day] |- |Belgium || 218 || 60% || 6 August|| 2015 || [[Ernst & Young Global Limited]] || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150924005245/http://www.ey.com/BE/en/Newsroom/News-releases/August-6th-is-Belgiums-tax-liberation-day] |- |Greece || 169 || 46% || 19 June|| 2012 || [[Φορολογικό Παρατηρητήριο, Κέντρο Φιλελεύθερων Μελετών – Μάρκος Δραγούμης]] || [http://www.libertyforum.gr/activity/publishing/182--tax-freedom-day] |- |Poland || 173 || 47% || 22 June|| 2013 || [[Centrum im. Adama Smitha]] || [http://www.smith.org.pl] |- |Germany || 192 || 52% || 11 July|| 2015 || [[Bund der Steuerzahler]] || [http://www.steuerzahler.de/Von-1-Euro-bleiben-nur-476-Cent/65996c76569i1p1520/index.html] |- |Israel || 197 || 54% || 14 July || 2013 || [[Jerusalem Institute for Market Studies]] || [https://web.archive.org/web/20130913073944/http://www.jims-israel.org/TFD2013.aspx] |- |Turkey || 194 || 53% || 14 July|| 2012 || [[Liberal Democratic Party (Turkey)|Liberal Democratic Party]] || [http://www.ldp.org/14-temmuz-vergiden-kurtulus-gunu-kutlu-olsun/] |- |Norway || 210 || 57% || 29 July|| 2007 || [[Skattebetalerforeningen]] || [http://www.skattebetalerforeningen.no] |- |France || 210 || 57% || 29 July|| 2014 || [[Economie Politique]] || [http://economiepolitique.org/travaille-t-on-temps-payer-ses-impots/]{{vc|date=August 2014}} |- |Bosnia and Herzegovina || 161 || 44% || 10 June|| 2017 || [[Centre for Policy and Governance «Centar za politike i upravljanje»]] || [http://mojporez.ba] |- |} ===European Union=== A 2010 study published in L'Anglophone,[http://www.langlophone.com/20100526_edition/20100526_EU27_data_table_flipped.pdf Wages and Taxes for the Average Joe in the EU 27] a Brussels newspaper, compared the tax burdens of "Average Joes" in each of the 27 EU member states and projected the Tax Freedom Day for workers earning a typical wage. Income taxes, social security contributions (by the employee and the employer) and projected VAT contributions were included in the calculations. Regarding the discrepancy between their calculation of August 3 as the typical Belgian worker's Tax Freedom Day and that of PriceWaterhouseCoopers (PWC), L'Anglophone's authors wrote:[http://www.langlophone.com/fullbn.php?id=419 Belgian Workers’ Wages are Highest-Taxed in Western Europe] "[PWC's] figures count revenue from all taxes (including those on corporate profits, petrol, cigarettes, &c.) and thus present a more complete picture of the country’s total tax burden," adding that it is "an average applied to all Belgians – not all Belgian workers; in 2008, less than half of Belgium’s population (4.99 million working out of 10.67 million citizens) was legally working. Consequently, a huge share of Belgium’s tax burden is borne by the working population." {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ '''2010 Tax Freedom Days for the "Average Joe" in the European Union, as published in L'Anglophone''' ! Country !! Day of year !! % burden !! class="unsortable" |Date of year |- |Austria || 191 || 52% || 10 July |- |Belgium || 215 || 59% || 3 August |- |Bulgaria || 145 || 40% || 25 May |- |Cyprus || 72 || 19% || 13 March |- |Czech Rep. || 165 || 45% || 14 June |- |Denmark || 168 || 46% || 17 June |- |Estonia || 150 || 41% || 30 May |- |Finland || 166 || 45% || 15 June |- |France || 207 || 56% || 26 July |- |Germany || 200 || 55% || 19 July |- |Greece || 164 || 45% || 13 June |- |Hungary || 218 || 59% || 6 August |- |Ireland || 117 || 32% || 27 April |- |Italy || 169 || 46% || 18 June |- |Latvia || 161 || 44% || 10 June |- |Lithuania || 167 || 45% || 16 June |- |Luxembourg || 135 || 37% || 15 May |- |Malta || 99 || 27% || 9 April |- |Netherlands || 184 || 50% || 3 July |- |Poland || 160 || 44% || 9 June |- |Portugal || 150 || 41% || 30 May |- |Romania || 178 || 49% || 27 June |- |Slovakia || 167 || 46% || 16 June |- |Slovenia || 164 || 45% || 13 June |- |Spain || 136 || 37% || 16 May |- |Sweden || 181 || 49% || 30 June |- |United Kingdom || 134 || 36% || 13 May |- |} ==Criticism== In the book ''[[Filthy Lucre: Economics for People Who Hate Capitalism]]'', philosopher [[Joseph Heath]] criticizes the idea that tax-paying is inherently different from consumption:
It would make just as much sense to declare an annual "mortgage freedom day", in order to let mortgage owners know what day they "stop working for the bank and start working for themselves". ...But who cares? Homeowners are not really "working for the bank"; they're merely financing their own consumption. After all, they're the ones living in the house, not the bank manager.{{cite book|last=Heath|first=Joseph|title=[[Filthy Lucre (book)|Filthy Lucre]]|pages=90}}
===Mathematical=== For Canada the [[Fraser Institute]] also includes a “Personal Tax Freedom Day Calculator” that estimates a customized Tax Freedom Day based on additional variables such as age of household head, sex of household head, marital status and number of children. However, the Fraser Institute's figures have been disputed. For example, a 2005 study by [[Osgoode Hall]] Law Professor Neil Brooks{{citation |url=http://www.osgoode.yorku.ca/faculty/neilbrooks.html |institution=Osgoode Hall |title=Professor Neil Brooks |year=2005 |accessdate=11 December 2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20051216161715/http://www.osgoode.yorku.ca/faculty/neilbrooks.html |archivedate=16 December 2005 |df= }} argues the Fraser Institute's Tax Freedom Day analysis includes flawed accounting, including the exclusion of several important forms of income and overstating tax figures, moving the date nearly two months later.{{citation|url=http://www.policyalternatives.ca/sites/default/files/uploads/publications/National_Office_Pubs/2005/tax_freedom_day.pdf |title=Tax Freedom Day – A Flawed, Incoherent, and Pernicious Concept |date=5 June 2005 |accessdate=16 August 2016}} In America, while Tax Freedom Day presents an "average American" tax burden, it is not a tax burden typical for an American. That is, the tax burdens of most Americans are substantially overstated by Tax Freedom Day. The larger tax bills associated with higher incomes increases the average tax burden above that of most Americans. The [[Tax Foundation]] defends its methodology by pointing out that Tax Freedom Day is the U.S. economy's overall average tax burden—not the tax burden of the "average" American, which is how it is often misinterpreted by members of the media.[http://www.taxfoundation.org/news/show/1406.html] Tax Foundation materials do not use the phrase "tax burden of the average American", although members of the media often make this mistake.[http://www.taxfoundation.org/taxfreedomday/ The Tax Foundation – America Celebrates Tax Freedom Day] Another criticism is that the calculation includes [[capital gain]]s taxes but not capital gains income, thus overstating the tax burden. For example, in the late 1990s the US Tax Freedom Day moved later, reaching its latest date ever in 2000, but this was largely due to capital gains taxes on the bull market of that era rather than an increase in tax rates. In other words, variations in capital gains income and their associated taxes cause changes in the amount of taxes, but not in the income used in the calculation of Tax Freedom Day. The Tax Foundation argues that the Tax Freedom Day calculation does not include capital gains as income because it uses income and tax data directly from the [[Bureau of Economic Analysis]] (BEA). BEA has never counted [[capital gain]]s as income since they don't represent current production available to pay taxes, and so the Tax Foundation excludes them as well. Additionally, the Tax Foundation argues that the exclusion of capital gains income is irrelevant in most years since including capital gains would only shift Tax Freedom Day by 1 percent in either direction in most years.[http://www.taxfoundation.org/news/show/1406.html] A 1 percent change would represent 3.65 days. From 1968 to 2009 the date has never left the 21-day range of April 13 to May 3. == See also == * [[List of countries by tax rates]] * [[List of countries by tax revenue as percentage of GDP]] * [[Rahn curve]] * [[Government spending]] * [[Laffer curve]] ==Notes== {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.taxfoundation.org/taxfreedomday/ Tax Foundation's Tax Freedom Day] * [http://actionamerica.org/taxecon/taxfrdmclk.shtml Tax Freedom Day Clock] A live clock that counts the days till/since Tax Freedom Day * [http://actionamerica.org/taxecon/uktaxfrdmclk.shtml Tax Freedom Day Clock (UK)] A live clock that counts the days till/since UK Tax Freedom Day * [http://altax.al/al/publikime-te-altax/product/barra-tatimore-ne-shqiperi-dhe-ballkan-2017] Tax burden in Albania and Balkans, 2017 * Criticism: [http://www.cbpp.org/cms/index.cfm?fa=view&id=2753 Tax Foundation Figures Do Not Represent Typical Households’ Tax Burdens] ** Response to Criticism: [http://www.taxfoundation.org/files/wp3-20080326.pdf Tax Freedom Day: A Description of Its Calculation and Answers to Some Methodological Questions] [[Category:Tax]] [[Category:Unofficial observances]] [[Category:Libertarian terms]]

{{Infobox film | name = The Adventures of Jinbao | image = | caption = | director = Kwok-Shing Lo | producer = Ye Maoxi
Meta Chen | writer = Andy Ng Yiu-Kuen
Lam Fung | starring = [[Rob Schneider]]
[[Haylie Duff]]
[[Norm MacDonald]]
Lauren Elizabeth
[[Tom Kenny]] | music = Lui Jia | editing = Kwok-Shing Lo
Hu Jianhui | studio = Legendtoonland Limited | distributor = [[Grindstone Entertainment Group]] | released = {{film date|2012|8|10|China|2016|8|2|USA|df=yes}} | runtime = 78 minutes | country = China
United States | language = Mandarin
English | budget = | gross = $385,656{{cite web|url=https://www.the-numbers.com/movie/Da-bing-jin-bao-li-xian-ji#tab=summary |title=Da Bing Jin Bao Li Xian Ji Financial Information |publisher=The Numbers.com |date= |accessdate=2018-10-02}} }} '''''The Adventures of Jinbao''''' ([[Chinese language|Chinese]]: '''大兵金寶歷險記''') (Released as '''''The Adventures of Panda Warrior''''' in the US) is a 2012 Chinese [[Computer animation|computer-animated]] [[action comedy film|action comedy]] [[martial arts film]] directed by Kwok-Shing Lo and written by Andy Ng Yiu-Kuen and Lam Fung. The film's English cast features [[Rob Schneider]], [[Haylie Duff]], [[Norm MacDonald]], Lauren Elizabeth, and [[Tom Kenny]]. [[Jackie Chan]] also voiced the film's protagonist in the Cantonese release. Many of the film's fight scenes were animated using [[Motion Capture]]. ==Plot== A peace-loving soldier from Ancient China is magically transported into a world ruled by an evil nine-headed snake. Transformed into a panda, he joins forces with a flying pig to free the once-peaceful Merryland from tyranny. But first, he must train to be the kingdom's most courageous panda warrior. ==Cast== *[[Rob Schneider]] as Patrick Panda (Jinbao) & Jimmy Ginseng **[[Jackie Chan]] voiced Jinbao in the Cantonese language version of the film *[[Haylie Duff]] as GoGo Goat *[[Norm MacDonald]] as King Leo *Lauren Elizabeth as Peggy Skyflyer *[[Tom Kenny]] as Bernie Hothead, Manny Mantis, & Spinny *[[Jamieson Price]] as Crusher the Ox *[[Michael Sorich]] as Shadowfeet *[[Spike Spencer]] as Billy Beakman *[[Tom Fahn]] as Bruce Barkley *[[Wendee Lee]] as Bobby Bunny & Princess Angelica *[[Michael McConnohie]] as Captain *[[Derek Stephen Prince]] as Nine-Headed Snake [[Amanda Celine Miller]], [[Ben Pronsky]], and [[Tony Oliver]] provide additional voices in the film. ==Release== The film was released in its home country of China on August 10, 2012, in both 2D and 3D. The film was brought over to the US for an English language release in 2016, the English dub for the film was produced at [[Bang Zoom! Entertainment]] in [[California]] and features a few celebrity voices such as [[Rob Schneider]], [[Haylie Duff]], and [[Norm MacDonald]]. The English dub was released on DVD by [[Lionsgate Home Entertainment]] on August 2, 2016. There were a few changes done to the film for its American release, such as Jinbao's name being changed to Patrick. A song exclusive to the film's English dub called Miracle was included in the end credits, this same song was later used in the American release for [[Gamba no Bōken|Air Bound]]. ==Reception== The film received very negative reviews from critics and audiences. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Rotten Tomatoes|the_adventures_of_panda_warrior}} *{{IMDb title|id=5779650|title=The Adventures of Panda Warrior}} *[https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/movies/The-Adventures-of-Panda-Warrior/ The Adventures of Panda Warrior] on Behind the Voice Actors {{DEFAULTSORT:Adventures of Jinbao}} [[Category:2012 films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:Chinese films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Chinese-language films]] [[Category:2010s American animated films]] [[Category:2010s animated films]] [[Category:2012 animated films]] [[Category:2016 films]] [[Category:2016 animated films]] [[Category:Martial arts films]] [[Category:Martial arts comedy films]] [[Category:Animated films about animals]] [[Category:Films featuring anthropomorphic characters]] [[Category:Films set in China]] [[Category:Films about animals]] [[Category:Films about bears]] [[Category:Fictional pandas]] [[Category:Films set in Ancient China]] [[Category:Films using computer-generated imagery]]

{{Infobox video game |title=The Baconing |image=Baconing cover.png |caption=Title art |developer=[[Hothead Games]] |publisher=[[Electronic Arts]] |series=''DeathSpank'' |released='''PlayStation 3'''
August 30, 2011
'''Mac OS X, Microsoft Windows, Xbox 360'''
August 31, 2011 |genre=[[Action role-playing game|Action role-playing]] |modes=[[Single-player video game|Single-player]]. [[Multiplayer video game|multiplayer]] |platforms=[[Mac OS X]], [[Microsoft Windows]], [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]] }} '''''The Baconing''''' is an [[Action role-playing game|action role-playing]] [[video game]] developed by [[Hothead Games]]. It was published by [[Valcon Games]] on the [[Xbox 360]] and independently on all other platforms. It was released August 30, 2011 for [[PlayStation 3]] via the [[PlayStation Network]] and August 31, 2011 for [[Mac OS X]] and [[Microsoft Windows]] via [[Steam (software)|Steam]] and for the Xbox 360 via [[Xbox Live Arcade]]. It is the third game in the ''[[DeathSpank]]'' series, and follows the character DeathSpank in his quest to defeat the AntiSpank, an evil incarnation of himself. The game received mixed views from critics. Most critics enjoyed the game's humor, and those who did not noted that players who enjoyed the humor from the previous two games will enjoy ''The Baconing''. Critics were divided as to aspects of gameplay. Some thought that the game had too many repetitive quests, while others felt that gameplay was tightened in comparison to the previous two ''DeathSpank'' games. ==Premise== [[File:Baconing screenshot.png|thumb|left|The game world in ''The Baconing'' is much more varied than that of the previous two ''DeathSpank'' titles.]] {{See also|DeathSpank#Synopsis|l1=synopses of DeathSpank|DeathSpank: Thongs of Virtue#Synopsis|l2=DeathSpank: Thongs of Virtue}} The game opens with a bored DeathSpank, the series' protagonist. Having defeated all of his foes in the land, he decides to try on all six mystical Thongs of Virtue at once, and in doing so inadvertently creates an evil incarnation of himself, the AntiSpank. DeathSpank must then travel the land to destroy five of the six Thongs of Virtue in the Fires of Bacon. Once he is successful he can defeat the AntiSpank and bring peace to SpankTopia.{{cite video game | title=The Baconing | developer=Hothead Games |date=2011-08-31}} ==Gameplay== {{See also|DeathSpank#Gameplay|l1=Gameplay in DeathSpank}} ''The Baconing'' borrows much of its gameplay from the two previous titles in the ''DeathSpank'' series, ''[[DeathSpank]]'', and ''[[DeathSpank: Thongs of Virtue]]''. As with the previous games, this title is an action RPG. The game can also be played cooperatively, with the first player controlling DeathSpank and the second having a choice to control one of four sidekicks.{{Cite web |url=http://www.thebaconing.com/about/ |publisher=[[Hothead Games]] |accessdate=2011-09-02 |title=About The Baconing}} Hothead Games addressed a concern from fans about [[fetch quest]]s, a [[Quest (video gaming)|quest]] which involves retrieving an object for the person giving the player character the quest.{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamespot.com/pc/action/deathspank-the-baconing/news/6327490/the-baconing-preview?sid=6327490&tag=result;title;0&mode=previews |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |accessdate=2011-09-06 |date=2011-08-08 |first=Sophia |last=Tong |title=The Baconing Preview}} The player can now have the character execute a shield bash to push enemies away. This ability can also be used to reflect incoming arrows back toward enemies. ==Development and marketing== ''The Baconing'' was announced on May 25, 2011 for the Mac OS X, Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3.{{Cite web |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2011/05/25/deathspank-the-baconing-is-the-third-entry-in-the-deathspank-se/ |publisher=[[Joystiq]] |accessdate=2011-09-02 |date=2011-05-25 |first=Ben |last=Gilbert |title=DeathSpank: The Baconing is the third entry in the DeathSpank series, coming this summer}} ''DeathSpank'' was dropped from the game's title, though it is a continuation of the ''DeathSpank'' series. Producer Mike Inglehart stated "This new title isn't ''DeathSpank 3'' or ''DeathSpank: The Baconing'', instead it should be thought of as ''The Baconing''." Inglehart elaborated by saying that "this is a standalone experience that will appeal to fans of the DeathSpank character, but also to gamers everywhere who love unique and engaging video games."{{Cite web |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2011/05/27/hothead-explains-lack-of-deathspank-in-the-baconings-title/ |first=Ben |last=Gilbert |accessdate=2011-09-02 |date=2011-05-27 |publisher=Joystiq |title=Hothead explains lack of 'DeathSpank' in The Baconing's title}} Inglehart also clarified that the ''DeathSpank'' prefix was not removed due to copyright or trademark issues. To promote the game Hothead Games ran an Ask DeathSpank questionnaire on game's official website. Fans could submit their questions to be answered by the game's protagonist.{{Cite web |url=http://www.thebaconing.com/tag/ask-deathspank/ |title=Ask DeathSpank - The Baconing |accessdate=2011-09-06 |publisher=Hothead Games}} It was released on August 30, 2011 on the PlayStation 3 as part of the PSN Play promotion on the PlayStation Network.{{Cite web |url=http://kotaku.com/5828175/the-first-annual-playstation-network-play-lineup-brings-you-bacon-vampires-and-street-fighter-3-galore?tag=deathspank |publisher=[[Kotaku]] |accessdate=2011-09-02 |date=2011-08-05 |first=Joshua |last=Riviera |title=The First Annual PlayStation Network Play Lineup Brings You Bacon, Vampires, and Street Fighter 3 Galore}} The Mac OS X, Microsoft Windows and Xbox 360 versions were released on August 31, 2011.{{Cite web |url=http://ps3.ign.com/articles/119/1191794p1.html |publisher=[[IGN]] |accessdate=2011-09-15 |date=2011-08-31 |title=Crispy and Delicious, The Baconing is Now Released for All Platforms}} ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | GR = 69.10% (PS3)
64.89% (X360) | MC = 66/100 (PS3)
61/100 (X360) | GameRev = B+ | GSpot = 6/10 | IGN = 6/10 | Joystiq = {{rating|2|5}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2011/08/31/the-baconing-review/ |title=The Baconing review: Hacked and slashed |first=Taylor |last=Cocke |date=2011-08-31 |accessdate=2011-09-02 |publisher=Joystiq}} | rev1 = ''[[PlayStation LifeStyle.net]]'' | rev1Score = 8/10{{Cite web |url=http://playstationlifestyle.net/2011/09/01/psn-review-the-baconing/ |title=PSN Review – The Baconing |date=2011-09-01 |first=Josh |last=Fernandes |accessdate=2011-09-02 |publisher=PlayStation Lifestyle}} }} ''The Baconing'' has received mixed reviews from critics. The game holds a score of 69.10% for the PlayStation 3 version and 64.89% for the Xbox 360 at [[GameRankings]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/ps3/631679-the-baconing/index.html |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |accessdate=2011-09-06 |title=The Baconing for PlayStation 3 - GameRankings}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/xbox360/631680-the-baconing/index.html |publisher=GameRankings |accessdate=2011-09-06 |title=The Baconing for Xbox 360 - GameRankings}} [[Metacritic]] reports a score of 61/100 for the Xbox 360 version and 66/100 on the PlayStation 3.{{Cite web |accessdate=2011-09-06 |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-3/the-baconing|title=The Baconing Critic Reviews for PlayStation 3 at Metacritic}}{{Cite web |accessdate=2011-09-06 |publisher=Metacritic |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/the-baconing/critic-reviews |title=The Baconing Critic Reviews for Xbox 360 at Metacritic}} Review scores varied from a 40% approval rating given by Taylor Cocke of [[Joystiq]] to an 85% rating from [[Game Revolution]]'s Nick Tan. The majority of scores fell in the 60—70% range. Year-end 2011 sales exceeded 14,000 units on Xbox Live Arcade.{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/39713/Xbox_Live_Arcde_by_the_numbers__the_2011_year_in_review.php |publisher=[[Gamasutra]] |accessdate=2012-01-23 |first=Ryan |last=Langley |title=Xbox Live Arcade by the numbers - the 2011 year in review |date=2012-01-20}} Several reviewers praised the game's colorful characters, humor and voice acting. Will Herring of [[GamePro]] commented in his review that ''The Baconing'' has "clever writing and great voice acting throughout".{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamepro.com/article/reviews/222633/review-the-baconing-360-ps3/ |first=Will |last=Herring |accessdate=2011-09-15 |publisher=[[GamePro]] |title=Review: The Baconing (360/PS3) |date=2011-09-06|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http://www.gamepro.com/article/reviews/222633/review-the-baconing-360-ps3/&date=2011-11-30+22:29:21|archivedate=2011-12-01}} [[Eurogamer]]'s Christian Donlan called the game's writing "witty stuff" and added that "the script can't wait to shoot off on strange tangents".{{Cite web |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-09-06-the-baconing-review |date=2011-09-06 |accessdate=2011-09-15 |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |title=The Baconing - Review |first=Christian |last=Donlan}} Tom Mc Shea of [[GameSpot]] also praised the game's cast and called them both "oddball" and "amusing".{{Cite web |url=http://www.gamespot.com/xbox360/action/deathspank-the-baconing/review.html?tag=updates%3Blatest%3Breviews%3Btitle%3B2 |publisher=GameSpot |accessdate=2011-09-02 |title=The Baconing Review |date=2011-09-01 |first=Tom |last=Mc Shea}} Nick Tan of [[Game Revolution]] felt that the dialogue was over-the-top and enjoyable as well.{{Cite web |publisher=[[Game Revolution]] |accessdate=2011-09-15 |url=http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/the-baconing |first=Nick |last=Tan |date=2011-09-02 |title=The Baconing Review}} Critics were divided on the gameplay aspects of ''The Baconing''. Game Revolution's Nick Tan noted that the combat system had been upgraded from the previous two titles, and that the addition of a shield bash mechanic helped when enemies crowded the player character. He also praised the new ability to choose between one of four characters for cooperative gameplay. GamePro's Will Herring, however, felt the gameplay was repetitive and that the fetch quests did not feature enough variety. Though Christian Donlan of Eurogamer had some critical remarks in regards to gameplay he did note that the game is "a fiercely likeable time-waster." [[IGN]]'s Kristine Steimer recommended that players consider playing ''DeathSpank: Thongs of Virtue'' first, as their opinion would be a good judge towards interest in ''The Baconing''.{{Cite web |url=http://ps3.ign.com/articles/119/1192096p1.html |publisher=[[IGN]] |accessdate=2011-09-02 |date=2011-09-01 |first=Kristine |last=Steimer |title=The Baconing Review}} {{-}} ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Portal|Video games}} {{Official website|http://www.thebaconing.com/}} {{DeathSpank}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Baconing}} [[Category:Role-playing video games]] [[Category:Action-adventure games]] [[Category:Action role-playing video games]] [[Category:Adventure games]] [[Category:Cooperative video games]] [[Category:Electronic Arts games]] [[Category:Fantasy video games]] [[Category:MacOS games]] [[Category:PlayStation Network games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Canada]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox 360 Live Arcade games]] [[Category:Xbox 360 games]] [[Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games]] [[Category:2011 video games]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox wrestling team |article_name = The IIconics |type = T |image = IIconics.png |image_size = 250px |caption = [[Billie Kay]] (left) and [[Peyton Royce]] (right) |alt = |members = [[Billie Kay]]
[[Peyton Royce]] |names = The Iconic Duo{{cite web|url=http://www.pwinsider.com/article/105177/ongoing-wwe-nxt-report-the-revival-faces-alexander-and-almas-in-the-dusty-rhodes-classic.html?p=1|title=WWE NXT Report: The Dusty Rhodes Tag Team Classics, One Of Last Year's Winners Makes An Impact, Peyton Royce Returns, And More|last=Richard|first=Trionfo|date=5 October 2016|accessdate=13 October 2016|work=Pro Wrestling Insider}}
'''The IIconics'''{{cite web|title=The IIconics put the entire Women's division on notice: WWE.com Exclusive, April 10, 2018|url=http://www.wwe.com/videos/the-iiconics-put-the-entire-womens-division-on-notice-wwecom-exclusive-april-10-2018|publisher=WWE|accessdate=12 April 2018}} |heights = Billie Kay: {{height|ft=5|in=8}}
Peyton Royce: {{height|ft=5|in=7}} |weights = {{convert|264|lb|kg|abbr=on}} |billed = [[Sydney]], [[Australia]] |former_members = |debut = October 5, 2016 |disbanded = |years_active = 2016–present }} '''The IIconics''' (formerly '''The Iconic Duo''') are a [[professional wrestling]] [[tag team]] currently signed to [[WWE]], performing on the [[SmackDown (WWE brand)|SmackDown brand]], consisting of [[Billie Kay]] and [[Peyton Royce]].{{cite web|title=Billie Kay|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/billie-kay|publisher=WWE|accessdate=15 April 2018}}{{cite web|title=Peyton Royce|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/peyton-royce|publisher=WWE|accessdate=15 April 2018}} == History == === WWE === ==== NXT (2016–2018) ==== The team made their original debut on October 5, 2016 episode of ''[[WWE NXT|NXT]]'' and were later dubbed The Iconic Duo.{{cite web|title=The Iconic Duo hit the campaign trail in search of NXT Year-End Award votes|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwenxt/article/iconic-duo-campaign-nxt-year-end-awards-2017-votes?sf179037009=1|publisher=WWE|accessdate=15 April 2018}} During their time in NXT, the team received a [[NXT Year-End Award#2016 NXT Year-End Awards|NXT Year-End Award]] for "Breakout of the Year" in 2016 and were both nominated for "Female Competitor(s) of the Year" in 2017, though they were unsuccessful at winning the award.{{cite web|last1=Staff|first1=WWE.com|title=Vote now for the 2017 NXT Year-End Awards|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/wwenxt/article/nxt-2017-year-end-awards|website=WWE|accessdate=3 May 2018|language=en}} ==== SmackDown (2018–present) ==== Kay and Royce, now known as The IIconics,{{cite web|last=Paolo David|first=Juan|title=Reason Why Peyton Royce And Billie Kay Are Now Called 'The IIconics' Revealed|url=https://www.inquisitr.com/4864317/reason-why-peyton-royce-and-billie-kay-are-now-called-the-iiconics-revealed/|work=The Inquisitr|accessdate=12 April 2018|date=12 April 2018}}{{cite web|last=Ortman|first=Randall|title=Rumor Roundup (April 12, 2018): UFC and WWE TV deals, Broken Universe DVD, SmackDown title picture, more!|url=https://www.cagesideseats.com/2018/4/12/17224662/rumor-roundup-april-12-2018-ufc-wwe-tv-deals-broken-universe-dvd-impact-smackdown-title-picture|work=Cageside Seats|accessdate=15 April 2018}}{{cite web|last=Pritchard|first=Bill|title=Possible Reason For WWE Changing Peyton Royce And Billie Kay's Name To 'The IIconics' - Wrestlezone|url=http://www.mandatory.com/wrestlezone/news/942909-possible-reason-wwe-changing-peyton-royce-billie-kays-name-iiconics|work=Mandatory|accessdate=15 April 2018|date=12 April 2018}} debuted on the April 10, 2018 episode of ''[[WWE SmackDown|SmackDown Live]]'', attacking [[WWE SmackDown Women's Championship|SmackDown Women's Champion]] [[Charlotte Flair]], allowing [[Carmella (wrestler)|Carmella]] to cash in her [[Money in the Bank ladder match|Money in the Bank contract]] and defeat Flair to win the championship.{{cite web|title=NXT's Billie Kay and Peyton Royce make their debut by attacking and leaving her bruised SmackDown Women's Champion Charlotte Flair|url=http://www.wwe.com/videos/billie-kay-and-peyton-royce-attack-charlotte-flair-smackdown-live-april-10-2018|publisher=WWE|accessdate=12 April 2018}}{{cite web|title=Carmella cashes in to steal the SmackDown Women's Championship away from Charlotte Flair|url=http://www.wwe.com/videos/carmella-cashes-in-her-money-in-the-bank-contract-on-charlotte-flair-smackdown-live-april-10-2018|accessdate=12 April 2018}}{{cite web|title=Photos: Carmella cashes in after The IIconics ruthlessly ambush The Queen|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/smackdown/2018-04-10/gallery/carmella-cashes-in-her-money-in-the-bank-contract-on-charlotte|publisher=WWE|accessdate=12 April 2018}} The following week on ''SmackDown Live'', The IIconics picked up their first main roster victory by defeating [[Asuka (wrestler)|Asuka]] and [[Becky Lynch]].{{cite web|title=WWE SmackDown LIVE results, April 24, 2018: The lows continue for Styles as Nakamura strikes yet again|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/smackdown/2018-04-24#full-detail-40041976|website=WWE|language=en}} == Other media == Kay and Royce made their video game debut in ''[[WWE 2K18]]''.{{cite web|last1=Artus|first1=Matthew|title=The New Day arrive with 47 Superstars in final WWE 2K18 roster reveal update|url=http://www.wwe.com/section/wwe-2k18/article/wwe-2k18-roster-reveal-week-four-playable-character-list|website=WWE|accessdate=3 May 2018|language=en}} == Championship and accomplishments == *
